Topic.Title: "A coward dies a thousand times before his death, but the valiant taste of death but once."

Message.Msg: Peppeek's investigation isn't going well: "The U.S. Mission in Benghazi convened an “emergency meeting” less than a month before the assault that killed Ambassador Chris Stevens and three other Americans, because Al Qaeda had training camps in Benghazi and the consulate could not defend against a “coordinated attack,” according to a classified cable reviewed by Fox News. Summarizing an Aug. 15 emergency meeting convened by the U.S. Mission in Benghazi, the Aug. 16 cable marked “SECRET” said that the State Department’s senior security officer, also known as the RSO, did not believe the consulate could be protected. “RSO (Regional Security Officer) expressed concerns with the ability to defend Post in the event of a coordinated attack due to limited manpower, security measures, weapons capabilities, host nation support, and the overall size of the compound,” the cable said. According to a review of the cable addressed to the Office of the Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, the Emergency Action Committee was also briefed "on the location of approximately ten Islamist militias and AQ training camps within Benghazi … these groups ran the spectrum from Islamist militias, such as the QRF Brigade and Ansar al-Sharia, to ‘Takfirist thugs.’” Each U.S. mission has a so-called Emergency Action Committee that is responsible for security measures and emergency planning."

... “I understand that a Company in Spain, (headed by George Soros), makes most of the voting machines” Rob, it seems one of your side’s tactics is to constantly accuse the opposition of doing something that you know full well you, yourselves have been doing all along or again plan to. That’s not unlike most of the banter on this board, which, generally results in your responses being the political equivalent of “So’s your Mother!” While that’s an expedient and curt resource on the playground, it’s a bit juvenile for the political arena, depending, of course, on what base of the electorate you are targeting. Unfortunately, the Tea Party has consistently answered that question, as do you guys with your rants of ignorance and racism. From GlobalResearch – “While the story (about Soros), spread first by public airwaves clown and radio host Michael Savage and, naturally, Fox ‘News,’ is completely false, the general concern at the heart of it is not. Indeed, it underscores, yet again, the very point we’ve been making on this topic here for years… …several large Romney campaign donors and Romney's own son Tagg have financial ties to voting machine producer Hart InterCivic, Hamilton County, Ohio's voting machine provider…two of its parent corporation’s executives have directly contributed to the Romney campaign despite being board members at an organization that must, by its nature, remain neutral in campaigns. When you put together the Hart executives' obvious bias toward Romney, the opportunities for manipulation of election results, the fact that Ohio is a key battleground state, and the reciprocation of investments between the capital firms, it's not hard to feel a certain note of disconcert. This appears to be a repeat of the infamous former CEO of Diebold Wally O’Dell, who raised money for Bush while his company supplied voting machines and election management software in the 2004 election.” And we in Ohio remember it well, because O’Dell even had the audacity to send a fund raising letter on behalf of George W. Bush in ‘03 stating that he was committed to “to helping Ohio deliver its electoral votes to the President.” Talk about flagrant, and you have the audacity to criticize others? Keep in mind, O’Dell also later left the company when being investigated by the SEC for insider trading…but, of course, you guys don’t want any regulations on Wall Street, either. Gee, there seems to be a pattern there. “Today, my family (wife & kids), and I participated in early voting, here in the People's Republic. The lines were out the door, and snaked around the building asked several people what made them turn out. None appeared to be Barry's supporters” – more rob Yeah, rob, sure you did. Everybody goes to the polls and asks others for their political philosophy on why they showed up. I can see it now. Rob and family (apparently he took the girls out of college to go vote): to a crowded polling place of predominantly African-Americans (none of which, according to rob “appeared to be Barry’s supporters”????? What did they appear to be, then, rob? The John Birch Society??): “Excuse me, but my family and I were wondering if you, like us, are voting for Romney because you’re fed up with crime and illegal immigration. You know, the GOP and the Tea Party are terribly concerned with the well being of we people of color.” Response: “Are you talkin’ to me, you jive-a#S Uncle Tom? What the fock is that you’re driving??? Oh, man, oh, man…look at this fool…he’s drivin’ a Prius…what’s wrong with you, Oreo? Don’t be askin’ me who I vote for, fool. I vote you get your sorry Herman Cain butt outta’ here!!!” Incidentally, rob, while you’re complaining about the lines you had to stand in at your “family outing”…you know in Maryland you could have requested an absentee ballot long ago (up until yesterday, as a matter of fact) and mailed it in, like most smart people have already done. I guess you guys just needed to get out for awhile. “We still could loose (sic) though.” Yes, indeed, you certainly could. That’s because you are a “looser”. Down with pubic educashun…Tee Partiers Untie!

Topic.Title: Things we can all learn from Senator Bob

Message.Msg: ... “If you treat your constituents like you treat (blank), then don't be surprised if they rat you out.” – frog clown “In interviews, the two women said they met Menendez around Easter...They claimed Menendez agreed to pay them $500, but in the end they each received only $100. The women spoke through a translator in the company of their attorney, Melanio Figueroa. Both asked that their identities remain obscured for fear of reprisals in the Dominican Republic. When shown a photograph of Sen. Menendez, the women said they recognized him as the man with whom they’d had s--ual relations...Neither knew the identity of the man at the time. Both claimed to recognize him later as Sen. Menendez.” Hey, gremlin...Is this really your best shot? Two anonymous #$%$ who refuse to be identified making claims about something that happened last Spring in the Dominican Republic? Whether or not a single politician on vacation (he’s not cheating, as he’s divorced) paid for a prostitute in the Dominican is really not any of my business nor my concern. You probably would have spent more money trying to wine them and dine them, lavish them with gifts, dinner and dancing ‘til the wee hours, simply hoping they might blow the warts off your tadpole...same difference, more expensive. Hey, if you really want to make an argument, why not defend them with Lily Ledbetter pay discrepancies? Funny how, in the midst of your War on Women, you somehow turn into a total hypocrite like Henry Hyde and Newt Gingrich while they were going after Clinton with their overzealous moral fervor: “Former House Speaker Newt Gingrich said on Fox news (March, 2011) that it wasn't hypocritical of him to lead impeachment proceedings against President Bill Clinton in the 1990's, even though he was having an extramarital affair at the time, because the impeachment case was ‘not about personal behavior.’ So, if a spokesperson and potential candidate for your cause says it’s not about personal behavior, what’s your point? Oh, silly me... of course...pointless propaganda when there’s not much else left.

Topic.Title: Things we can all learn from Senator Bob

Message.Msg: ... “…you got all of the facts and his full name out there for everyone to see” Uh, excuse me? What is that supposed to mean? How many Senator Bob’s have been accused of cavorting in the Dominican in the past few days? So, why don’t you explain to everybody why you brought it up in the first place? Now suddenly you’re trying to protect the guy’s I.D.? I swear, you guys just type for the sake of typing…no thought behind it, at all. “I know this won't fit your narrow view of hypocracy (sic), but I seem to remember Senator Bob calling for the firing of some Secret Service agents back in April for their unpardonable sins.” Do you suppose anybody at all, other than you phony, fundamentalist, moralistic-hypocrites, would criticize those agents about anything if they were off on their own vacation? They were on assignment, you simpleton. “Wow echo, you sure did tell me off, “ What is that…the complimentary close of a letter? You punctuate and spell like jon, and your “Bill & Hill”* routine is rob’s normal gig. Honestly, the people you represent who think Americans are stupid, really shouldn’t send out people to make their pitch who are stupider than their target audience. * Speaking of your “Bill & Hill” story, you began with, “As I understand the story it went something like this:” So your inference is that you have some actual source to explain what you are about to tell us. You then give your opinion of the inside workings of the Democratic Party, with absolutely no basis for reality, followed with, “Just my humble opinion.” And you wonder why Middle America isn’t buying your repetitive fractured logic? Ribbit.

Message.Msg: ... “cause stupider .. ain't in the dictionary (chuckles)” – jon’s part-time research assistant from the carwash on acid (note spelling) Stu-pid (The Free Dictionary) adj. stu•pid•er, stu•pid•est (wait…what was that first one?) 1. Slow to learn or understand; obtuse. 2. Tending to make poor decisions or careless mistakes. 3. Marked by a lack of intelligence or care; foolish or careless: a stupid mistake. 4. Dazed, stunned, or stupefied. 5. Pointless; worthless: a stupid job. n. A stupid or foolish person. 6. jon3retired – Hey, jon, what’s that adjective up there? Right; had you read further, you’d have seen: Ex: adj. : jon was stupider than rob, who’s stupider than windalefrogg, who’s stupider than those thinking America is stupid. Stupid, insipid, morbid, limpid, devoid, sordid, overpaid, putrid, paranoid, flaccid, rabid, unlaid, lurid, and did we say stupid? Common denominator? ID - Freudian uncontrollable chaotic drive for power (some say neurosis), in constant struggle with the ego.(The part of humans from which the basic animal instincts derived) Achieving Super Ego status to counter the ID, is something lacking in the far right ideology. Why bother progressing? We’re happy where we are. Serfs, bring us the wine and the ladies. (Wow, Ann Coulter tapping a keg!)…ID…get lucid, idiots.
